statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Miami 67, Wofford 64
article.story: CORAL GABLES, Fla. (AP) -- Anthony King grabbed 19 rebounds and added eight points as Miami held off a late Wofford rally to 67-64 on Saturday night. Wofford pulled to within one point at 63-62 on an Adrien Borders 3-pointer with 4:10 left in the game and cut Miami's lead to 65-64 on a reverse layup by Howard Wilkerson with 2:11 remaining. Backup point guard Brandon Okpalobi hit a twisting layup with 1:20 left to push the Hurricanes lead to 67-64, but missed a wide-open layup with 22 seconds remaining. Wofford guard Drew Gibson's 3-point attempt caromed in and out, and King was fouled by Wilkerson. King's miss from the free throw line with 14 seconds left gave the Terriers one more shot to tie the game, but Eric Marshall missed from the left corner. It was the first game as a college head coach for Miami coach Frank Haith, 39, and the first game as a member of the Atlantic Coast Conference for the Hurricanes. King recorded the highest rebounding total by a Miami player since the rebirth of the program in 1985-86. Gary Hamilton also had 15 rebounds for the Hurricanes, who were led by Guillermo Diaz's 13 points. Wilkerson led the Terriers with 23 points and nine rebounds. Miami took a hit when starting point guard Anthony Harris injured his right leg on a shot attempt. Harris limped to the bench before being escorted to the locker room with just under 6 minutes remaining.
